TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SayAs extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates the content types for the speaking of elements such as times, dates, and currency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptBuilder.AppendTextWithHint%2A> method uses members of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs> enumeration to specify the content type of the appended text, which the speech synthesis engine can use to inform its pronunciation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Date = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a date. For example, speak "05/19/2004" or "19.5.2004" as "may nineteenth two thousand four".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Day = int32(13)

Docs.summary: Speak a number as the day in a date. For example, speak "3rd" as "third".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs DayMonth = int32(10)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a day and month. For example, speak "12/05" as "May twelfth", and speak "05/12" as "December 5th".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs DayMonthYear = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a date including the day, month, and year. For example, speak "12/05/2004" as "May twelfth two thousand four".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Month = int32(12)

Docs.summary: Speak a word as a month. For example, speak "June" as "June".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs MonthDay = int32(9)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a month and day. For example, speak "05/12" as "may twelfth", and speak "12/5" as "December 5th".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs MonthDayYear = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a date including the day, month, and year. For example, speak "12/05/2004" as "December fifth two thousand four".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs MonthYear = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a month and year. For example, speak "05/2004" as "May two thousand four".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs NumberCardinal = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Speak a number as a cardinal number. For example, speak "3" as "three".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs NumberOrdinal = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Speak a number as an ordinal number. For example, speak "3rd" as "third".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs SpellOut = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Spell the word or phrase. For example, say "clock" as "C L O C K".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Telephone = int32(17)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a U.S. telephone number. For example, speak "(306) 555-1212" as "Area code three zero six five five five one two one two".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Text = int32(18)

Docs.summary: Speak the word or phrase as text. For example, speak "timeline" as "timeline".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Time = int32(14)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a time. For example, speak "9:45" as "nine forty-five", and speak "9:45am" as "nine forty-five A M".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Time12 = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a time using the 12-hour clock. For example, speak "03:25" as "three twenty-five".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Time24 = int32(15)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a time using the 24-hour clock. For example, speak "18:00" as "eighteen hundred hours".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs Year = int32(11)

Docs.summary: Speak a number as a year. For example, speak "1998" as "nineteen ninety-eight".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs YearMonth = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a year and month. For example, speak "2004/05" as "May two thousand four".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.SayAs YearMonthDay = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Speak a number sequence as a date including the day, month, and year. For example, speak "2004/05/12" as "May twelfth two thousand four".
